titleStmt.title: The minde and iudgement of maister Frau[n]ces Lambert of Auenna of the wyll of man declarynge and prouynge howe and after what sorte it is captyue and bonde, and not free: taken out of hys commentaries vpon Osee the Prophete, wherin vpo[n] the. iiii. chapter of the sayd prophet, he most godly, plainlye and learnedly, entreateth and writeth of the same, as hereafter euide[n]tly shal appere. Newelye tra[n]slated into Englishe by N.L. Anno Do. M.D.xlviii. the xviii. day of Dece[m]bre.
titleStmt.author: Lambert, Franz, 1486-1530.
Lesse, Nicholas.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Iohn Day, and William Seres, dwellynge in Sepulchres parish, at the signe of the Resurrection, a litle aboue Holbourne conduite,

notesStmt.note: Signed at the end by the translator: Nicolas Lesse.
Printers' names and address from colophon.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: Sepulchres parish, at the signe of the Resurrection, a litle aboue Holbourne conduite
